bug.short_desc: Creation of a group does not open it some times

long_desc.thetext:
Behavioural change from latest commits,
Upon creation of a new review group the group was automatically opened. This is no longer the case.
This seems to happen when using Java 7, when using java 6 under the same work space, the issue does not appear.

Reverted back from java 6 to java 7 and the issue does not longer happen (!!!)
Not sure what's the trigger but some times the group is not opened during creation and when this happens, the creation does not seem to complete, so selecting this group will cause illegal argument exceptions.

This error will be triggered when selecting review groups which were not opened at creation. Probably the creation sequence did not complete. see bug 364478.
if the initial error in not produced we should find a way to recover from it, as the corrupted group is not usable.

The problem was reproduced creating review groups whose names contain a "." within the name for my case, I was trying something with a version number.
*** Bug 364166 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

THe problems happens because the EMF models replaces the '.' character with the '_' character when it creates the associated resources. The quickest solution is to prevent users from using the '.' character in review group and rule sets names. The '.' should also be prevented from use for review names as well as resources are also created that are directly associated with reviews

We should not prevent the user from using a dot character, all none alpha numerical characters are replaced for a "_" so the name of the resource and the name of the group will deviate and this is OK
The UI should not try to rebuild the pattern used for the resource, and use the URIs as they are created.
It seems that there are still problems with this (same exception occurs even after the fix, so I am reopening this bug
This needs to be retestested to see if it happends again
Tested with different characters in the group name and path, seems to open each time. The char non-alpha numeric are replaced by "_" and works as expected
